intro: Brachystelma modestum, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and colorful flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in a fine, white waxy coating. Brachystelma modestum is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves.
